content: * *Digital Economy Partnership Agreement** (**DEPA**) represents a new type of trade agreement to facilitate digital trade and creating a framework for the [digital economy](/wiki/Digital_economy), was born out of the common interest of [Chile](/wiki/Chile), [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand) and [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The agreement was virtually signed on June 12, 2020. [South Korea](/wiki/South_Korea) requested to participate on September 13, 2021. China requested to participate on October 31, 2021, and its formal accession process began on August 18, 2022. On May 3, 2024, South Korea joined DEPA as forth member - Digital Economy Partnership Agreement (DEPA) Foreign Trade Information System, [Organization of American States](/wiki/Organization_of_American_States) - Unpacking the Digital Economy Partnership Agreement(DEPA) - The Digital Economy Partnership Agreement, a milestone in trade negotiations This article related to a [treaty](/wiki/Treaty) is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Digital Economy Partnership Agreement
